es.definition: Relacionado con lo celestial o lo sagrado; supremamente bueno o hermoso.

pt.definition: Relacionado com o celestial ou o sagrado; supremamente bom ou belo.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Related to the celestial or the sacred; supremely good or beautiful.
examples: The cathedral's architecture is truly divine.
Many consider the sunset over the ocean to be a divine sight.
She had a divine talent for singing.
The priest spoke of divine intervention in their lives.
To meditate is to seek a connection with the divine.

es.definition: Instituciones financieras que ofrecen servicios de depósito y préstamo de dinero.

pt.definition: Instituições financeiras que oferecem serviços de depósito e empréstimo de dinheiro.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Financial institutions that offer deposit and loan services.
examples: I need to visit the banks to open a savings account.
Banks play a crucial role in the economy.
She works at one of the largest banks in the country.
They decided to banks together for their mortgage.
The riverbanks were lined with beautiful trees.

es.definition: El río más largo del mundo, ubicado en el noreste de África.

pt.definition: O rio mais longo do mundo, localizado no nordeste da África.

type_word.name: Proper Noun
type_word.description: Specific names of people, places, organizations, etc., that are capitalized.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The longest river in the world, located in Northeast Africa.
examples: The Nile River is of great historical and geographical significance.
Ancient Egypt thrived along the banks of the Nile.
They took a boat cruise on the Nile.
The Nile flows through multiple countries in Africa.
The Nile Delta is known for its fertile lands.

es.definition: Corriente natural de agua que fluye en una dirección específica.

pt.definition: Corrente natural de água que flui em uma direção específica.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A natural flow of water that moves in a specific direction.
examples: The Amazon River is the largest river in the world by volume.
Many cities are built along the banks of rivers.
They went fishing in the river last weekend.
The river meandered through the lush forest.
Crossing the river proved to be a challenging task.

es.definition: Que causa interés o atracción intensa; encantador.

pt.definition: Que causa interesse ou atração intensa; encantador.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Causing intense interest or attraction; charming.
examples: The documentary about space exploration was absolutely fascinating.
Her stories about her travels were always fascinating to listen to.
The history of ancient civilizations is truly fascinating.
He found the scientific research on the topic fascinating.
The art exhibition was a fascinating display of creativity.

es.definition: Un tramo específico de tiempo o una era en la historia.

pt.definition: Um período específico de tempo ou uma era na história.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A specific stretch of time or an era in history.
examples: The Jurassic period is known for its dinosaurs.
She studied the Romantic period in literature.
The Victorian period was marked by significant social changes.
The Middle Ages was a tumultuous period in European history.
The Renaissance period saw a revival of arts and learning.

es.definition: En o hacia qué lugar o dirección.

pt.definition: Em ou em direção a que lugar ou direção.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

type_word.name: Conjunction
type_word.description: Words that connect words, phrases, or clauses.

definition: In or toward what place or direction.
examples: Where are you going?
I don't know where he went.
Where did you find that treasure?
Tell me where you want to go.
The map shows where the treasure is buried.

es.definition: Sujeto a morir; que puede causar la muerte.

pt.definition: Sujeito a morrer; que pode causar a morte.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Subject to death; capable of causing death.
examples: All living creatures are mortal.
The mortal wound was too severe to heal.
He faced mortal danger during the expedition.
The duel was a fight to the mortal end.
The mortal remains of the king were laid to rest.

es.definition: Plural de 'mundo', que se refiere a planetas habitados o realidades diferentes.

pt.definition: Plural de 'mundo', que se refere a planetas habitados ou realidades diferentes.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Plural of 'world,' referring to inhabited planets or different realities.
examples: There may be other worlds beyond our solar system.
The worlds of science fiction often explore alternate realities.
Exploring new worlds has always been a human ambition.
In mythology, gods and creatures exist in different worlds.
The concept of parallel worlds is a fascinating topic.

es.definition: Unidos o conectados de manera compleja o íntima.

pt.definition: Unidos ou conectados de forma complexa ou íntima.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: United or connected in a complex or intimate way.
examples: Their fates were intertwined from a young age.
The two storylines in the novel are deeply intertwined.
Love and art are often intertwined in human experience.
The history of these two nations is tightly intertwined.
In nature, ecosystems are intricately intertwined.

es.definition: Que tiene una fecha específica o está cerrado a la entrada.

pt.definition: Que tem uma data específica ou está fechado para entrada.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Having a specific date or being closed to entry.
examples: The letter was dated April 15th, 2023.
The old building was dated and in need of renovation.
Her fashion choices looked dated compared to current trends.
The event is dated for next Saturday.
The museum is currently dated for maintenance work.

es.definition: En dirección al lugar de partida o hacia el pasado.

pt.definition: Em direção ao local de partida ou em direção ao passado.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: In the direction of the starting point or toward the past.
examples: The car backed into the parking space.
She took a step back from the edge of the cliff.
The company is looking back at its history.
The movie is set in the 1950s, looking back at the past.
The book looks back at the history of the country.

es.definition: Número que representa una cantidad.

pt.definition: Número que representa uma quantidade.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A number representing a quantity.
examples: The total cost is 3150 dollars.
She counted 3150 books on the shelf.
His car's mileage is 3150 miles.
They sold 3150 tickets for the concert.
The room can hold 3150 people.

es.definition: Abreviatura de 'Before Common Era' (Antes de la Era Común), utilizado para fechar eventos en la historia antes del año 1 CE (Era Común).

pt.definition: Abreviação de 'Antes da Era Comum', usada para datar eventos na história antes do ano 1 EC (Era Comum).

type_word.name: Abbreviation
type_word.description: Shortened form of a word or phrase.

definition: Abbreviation for 'Before Common Era,' used to date events in history before the year 1 CE (Common Era).
examples: The construction of the pyramids began in 2600 BCE.
The Bronze Age started around 3200 BCE.
The ancient civilization existed from 4000 BCE to 1000 BCE.
The Stonehenge monument was built around 2500 BCE.
Many historical artifacts date back to the period of 2000 BCE.

es.definition: Estar vivo; la condición de estar vivo.

pt.definition: Estar vivo; a condição de estar vivo.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Being alive; the condition of being alive.
examples: All living organisms require water to survive.
The living room is where we spend most of our time.
He believed in the afterlife where the soul continues living.
The study of living creatures is called biology.
Living beings exhibit various forms of life.

es.definition: Controlado o gobernado por una autoridad o líder.

pt.definition: Controlado ou governado por uma autoridade ou líder.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Controlled or governed by an authority or leader.
examples: The kingdom was ruled by a wise king.
During the monarchy, the country was ruled by queens and kings.
The dictator ruled with an iron fist.
The city is ruled by a mayor and city council.
Under the new law, the territory is ruled independently.

es.definition: Estar alrededor o cercado por algo.

pt.definition: Estar rodeado o cercado por algo.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: To be encircled or enclosed by something.
examples: The fortress was surrounded by a high stone wall.
She felt surrounded by the beauty of nature.
The city is surrounded by mountains on all sides.
The island is surrounded by clear blue waters.
They found themselves surrounded by a dense forest.

es.definition: Narrativas tradicionales que explican creencias o fenómenos, a menudo involucrando dioses o héroes.

pt.definition: Narrativas tradicionais que explicam crenças ou fenômenos, frequentemente envolvendo deuses ou heróis.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Traditional narratives that explain beliefs or phenomena, often involving gods or heroes.
examples: Greek myths tell the stories of ancient gods and heroes.
Myths from different cultures often have similar themes.
The myth of Atlantis has fascinated people for centuries.
Myths are a way to pass down cultural knowledge.
The creation myth explains how the world began.

es.definition: Historias populares o tradicionales que a menudo incluyen elementos sobrenaturales o extraordinarios.

pt.definition: Histórias populares ou tradicionais que frequentemente incluem elementos sobrenaturais ou extraordinários.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Popular or traditional stories often including supernatural or extraordinary elements.
examples: Arthurian legends tell of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.
Urban legends are often spooky or mysterious tales.
Legends about dragons exist in many cultures.
The legend of Robin Hood is a famous folk story.
Native American legends are rich in cultural significance.

es.definition: Un reino o dominio, especialmente en un contexto abstracto.

pt.definition: Um reino ou domínio, especialmente em um contexto abstrato.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A kingdom or domain, especially in an abstract context.
examples: In the realm of science, many discoveries are made.
She entered a realm of fantasy and imagination.
The realm of politics is often complex and unpredictable.
Exploring the realm of art can be a rewarding experience.
His writings delve into the realm of philosophy.

es.definition: Relacionado con lo que está más allá de lo natural o lo explicado por la ciencia; fenómeno inexplicable o misterioso.

pt.definition: Relacionado com o que está além do natural ou do explicado pela ciência; fenômeno inexplicável ou misterioso.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Related to what is beyond the natural or explained by science; inexplicable or mysterious phenomenon.
examples: Ghosts and spirits are often considered supernatural entities.
Many cultures have beliefs in supernatural powers.
The supernatural elements in the story add to its intrigue.
Exploring the supernatural can be both frightening and fascinating.
Some people have reported encounters with supernatural beings.

es.definition: Ser vivo; entidad con existencia y conciencia.

pt.definition: Ser vivo; entidade com existência e consciência.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A living being; an entity with existence and consciousness.
examples: Human beings are capable of complex thoughts and emotions.
All beings on Earth are connected through the ecosystem.
She believed in the existence of extraterrestrial beings.
In many myths, beings from other realms interact with humans.
The existence of supernatural beings is a topic of debate.

es.definition: Dioses o seres divinos en una religión o creencia.

pt.definition: Deuses ou seres divinos em uma religião ou crença.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Gods or divine beings in a religion or belief system.
examples: In Greek mythology, there are numerous deities with various powers.
Many ancient cultures worshiped a pantheon of deities.
These deities are often depicted in religious art and literature.
The concept of deities varies from one religion to another.
People offer prayers and sacrifices to their deities.
